title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Melbourne, FL

content.rendered:
Along the Indian River Lagoon, lies the coastal city of Melbourne in Florida, United States. The Lagoon is a favorite for boaters, anglers, and those who look for solace in its beauty. Additionally, being a coastal city means a beach life is accessible for its residents. So if you’re looking for cheap rooms for rent in Melbourne, FL, we’re here to help! So here’s your guide to everything about this city on Space Coast, along with the average rent in Melbourne.

Getting to know Melbourne, FL

Melbourne didn’t always go by this name. Formerly known as Crane Creek, it was then named Melbourne in honor of the first postmaster in the city, Cornthwaite John Hector, an Englishman who had spent much of his life in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

Moreover, if you’re on the hunt for cheap rooms for rent in Melbourne, you’ll be happy to know about its many lush gardens, ideal coastal climate, and beach towns that make it the perfect coastal city to live in.

Finding rooms for rent in Melbourne, FL

Find Rooms For Rent In Melbourne, FL

When looking for rooms for rent in Melbourne, you should know that the city’s population is mostly older retirees, and of course, the tourists who flock here for everything coastal.

Structure-wise, the east-west street or ‘Brevard Drive’ has historically been the center of the town with addresses as north and south of the street. Further, for east and west, the center is North-South Babcock Street.

Next, let’s take a look at the kind of neighborhoods you can find in Melbourne, FL.

Top neighborhoods in Melbourne, FL

  • Magnolia Park: This is a well established community with reasonably priced rooms for rent in Melbourne, and a neighborhood featuring cozy homes. Residents can enjoy spots like Crane Creek, the Brevard Zoo and more nearby attractions.
  • Alamanda Key: The neighborhood features two sparkling lakes, island-style clubhouse, pool, tennis court and more. Vine covered archways make the neighborhood perfect for walking, biking, jogging and a quiet evening stroll.
  • Wickham Forest: Close to everything you need, from the Melbourne International Airport and Eastern Florida State College to the Atlantic Ocean beaches and shopping centers, this community is perfect for people who want a quiet and beautiful neighborhood to live in.

Average rent in Melbourne, FL

University life in Melbourne, FL

If you’re moving to Melbourne for college, Reddit user, heathersaur has the best description for university life here.

It’ll depend on where you are coming from what your perspective will be like. Brevard is basically giant suburbia. You will need to make a little effort to “find things to do”, so make sure you’re looking at student orgs and events as well as exploring the area. Besides the beach and river (which btw, if you’re attending FIT they have kayaks you can borrow) there’s downtown Melbourne (Mainstreet Pub is the local college hangout), Eau Gallie Arts District, and Cocoa Village as the main ‘nightlife’ areas. Orlando isn’t that far away for day trips. I know FIT used to subsidize tickets to the theme parks sometimes (and even offer a bus to transport you there & back).

Top universities in Melbourne, FL:

  • Florida Institute of Technology
  • Webster University
  • Eastern Florida State College
  • Keiser University

How transit friendly is Melbourne, FL?

1. Walkability & cycling

The most walkable neighborhoods in Melbourne, FL are Magnolia Park, University Park & Bowe Gardens. With a walk score of 34, and bike score of 47, it’s a somewhat walkable and bikeable city. However, most commutes would require public or private transport.

2. Bus

The city is served by the Space Coast Area Transit with public bus services in the vicinity. Two internal routes have been subsidized for making commute-free for Melbourne residents.

The Greyhound Bus Lines also has a bus station in Melbourne, FL.

3. Air

Melbourne International Airport serves the city with daily flights on six passenger airlines and a cargo one, including Delta, Delta Connection, and American Eagle.

Cultural activities in Melbourne, FL

  • The Eau Gallie Arts District: A vibrant community boasting a rich history, an eclectic mix of art galleries, restaurants, shops and many more events all year round.
  • Manatee Cove Park: A fisherman’s retreat, the Manatee Cove Park is a refuge for manatees, and also a launch site for canoes. A natural trail around the lagoon also provides access for shoreline fishing.
  • Kennedy Space Center: At NASA’s Kennedy Space Center, visitors can enjoy exhibits, displays, historic spacecraft and memorabilia, shows in the IMAX theaters and more.

Historical spots in Melbourne, FL

  • Space Coast Stadium: Home to the USSSA Pride, the Space Coast Stadium hosts events and is operated by the largest multi-sport company in the world (The USSSA). Additionally, it contains 15 turf fields equipped with on-site covered batting cages, weight room availability, live streaming and much more. It is a great venue for players, and ultimately the audience that comes to catch the games.
  • Eau Gallie Causeway Bridge: The first wooden bridge across the Indian River Lagoon opened to traffic in 1926 on George Washington’s birthday. In 1955, the second causeway, a concrete bridge was dedicated to Dr. William Jackson Creel. Lastly, the third bridge, completed in 1988, is a high-rise causeway .
  • Liberty Bell Memorial Museum: The Liberty Bell Memorial Museum includes the Rotunda of American History that depicts history in a timeline fashion. It also showcases historic documents, patriotic memorabilia, and a replica of the Liberty Bell, the focal point of the museum.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Melbourne, FL? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
